intro: Satureja virginica, commonly known as Virginia savory, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, pink to purple flowers in the summer. Its leaves are aromatic, with a strong, pungent scent reminiscent of thyme and oregano. Virginia savory is often used in culinary and herbal applications due to its medicinal and flavorful properties.
